heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 13 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.6°C), outside temperature (down 1.9°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (down 152 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 2.9°C), cloud levels (up 336 m), and inside temperature (up 2.7°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 151.9m higher than yesterday, 61.4m lower than the past week, 336.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 926m to a maximum of 1357m, averaging 1237.0m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1298.4m and 1573.3m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Partial cloudiness with some periods of sun.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and winds will be practically absent. Showers, partial cloudiness with some periods of sun, and it’s dim outside. High pressure suggests settled weather.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
